par.text: Lead is a grey-coloured, soft metal, a weak conductor of electricity. Slightly heated, it can be easily shaped. A freshly cut surface is silvery, but turns dull very quickly, forming a coat of oxides: lead(II) oxide - PbO and lead(IV) oxide – Pb

, imparting the usual grey colour to the metal surface. Lead and its compounds are poisonous. Lead is the final product of the radioactive decay of uranium, thorium and actinium. Lead is one of the most well-known metals, in use since ancient times.
